required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Regulatory Requirement Post-Marketing Surveillance Study to Monitor the Safety and Efficacy of Twynsta (Telmisartan + Amlodipine SPC, q.d.) in Korean Hypertensive Patients Requiring Combination Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Regulatory Requirement Post-Marketing Surveillance Study to Monitor the Safety and Efficacy of Twynsta (Telmisartan + Amlodipine SPC, q.d.) in Korean Hypertensive Patients Requiring Combination Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, observational, open-label, multi-center study, which will provide detailed information about the safety and efficacy of Twynsta tablets in Korean hypertensive patients requiring combination therapy. This will present a convenient treatment option for hypertension in Korean patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Short term surveillance (8±2 weeks) and Long term surveillance (16±2 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with adverse events is presented. Results are reported for short term surveillance (8±2 weeks) and Long term surveillance (16±2 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Had Achieved Normal Blood Pressure (Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)/ Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) ＜ 140/90 mmHg)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who had achieved normal blood pressure (SBP/DBP ＜ 140/90 millimeters of mercury (mmHg))is presented

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved DBP Response (Defined as Mean Sitting DBP ＜ 90 mmHg or a Reduction of Over 10 mmHg)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who achieved DBP response (defined as mean sitting DBP ＜ 90 mmHg or a reduction of over 10 mmHg) is presented

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved SBP Response (Defined as Mean Sitting SBP ＜ 140 mmHg or a Reduction of Over 10 mmHg)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who achieved SBP response (defined as mean sitting SBP ＜ 140 mmHg or a reduction of over 10 mmHg) is presented

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Diabetes or Renal Impairment Who Achieved SBP/DBP < 130/80 mmHg.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with diabetes or renal impairment who achieved SBP/DBP < 130/80 mmHg is presented

intervention.description: Telmisartan and Amlodipine T40/A5, T80/A5 and T40/A10

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
No specific inclusion and exclusion criteria will be provided due to the exploratory character of the study. Patients who have initiated Twynsta tablets according to the recommended and approved usage in Korea will be consecutively enrolled.
Exclusion criteria:
No specific inclusion and exclusion criteria will be provided due to the exploratory character of the study. Patients who have initiated Twynsta tablets according to the recommended and approved usage in Korea will be consecutively enrolled.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Case report forms of subjects were retrieved from 34 investigators at 26 institutions
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study initiated on Dec 21, 2010, but the local health authority fixed the study period as August 19, 2010 to August 18, 2016

group.title: Twynsta® Tablets
group.description: Subjects who received Twynsta tablets (40/5 mg, 40/10 mg, and 80/5 mg) once daily orally with water. Twynsta is a fixed dose combination drug composed of Telmisartan and Amlodipine.

baseline.population: Subjects data collected during the surveillance period (19 Aug 2010 to 18 Aug 2016).

group.title: Twynsta® Tablets
group.description: Subjects who received Twynsta tablets (40/5 mg, 40/10 mg, and 80/5 mg) once daily orally with water. Twynsta is a fixed dose combination drug composed of Telmisartan and Amlodipine.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Had Achieved Normal Blood Pressure (Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)/ Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) ＜ 140/90 mmHg)
outcome.description: Percentage of subjects who had achieved normal blood pressure (SBP/DBP ＜ 140/90 millimeters of mercury (mmHg))is presented
outcome.population: An efficacy assessment was carried out for 531 subjects out of the 610 subjects in the safety assessment, excluding 70 subjects who had not recorded the mean sitting blood pressure (SBP, DBP) before or after the administration of the study drug and 9 subjects who had been administered the study drug for a duration shorter than 6 weeks (42 days)

outcome.population: Subjects data collected during the surveillance period (19 Aug 2010 to 18 Aug 2016).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events collected during the surveillance period (19 Aug 2010 to 18 Aug 2016); up to 313 weeks

group.title: Twynsta® Tablets

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights.
